note: referred to as "bugs") in a program. decimal - the numbers used in the base 10 system of numeric expression.
title: compiler - a built-in program which translates a high level computer language (such as BASIC) into machine language. CPU - Central Processing Unit, the heart of the computer which interprets and executes machine language instructions. CRT - Cathode Ray Tube. A video screen used for instantaneous communication between the user and the computer. data - any information processed by the computer. debug - to locate and correct errors
machine language - a code consisting of binary numbers which is directly understood by the computer. program - a series of instJuctions to be performed by the computer
the section of memory where information is temporarily stored. ROM - the section of memory where information is permanently stored
